person.persName: אושעיא So in the London – BL Harl. 5508 (400), the Oxford Opp. Add. Fol. 23 and in the Munich 140 Mss. This person was obviously not well known, and his name was not stable so that scribes of the mss were not sure how to write it, see vol. 4, Introduction 5.2.1.1.2.1.1, pp. 23-4. For this form see above, n. 8.
/הושעיא So in the Goettingen 3, the Cambridge T-S F2 (2) 73 and the Munich 95 Mss, see previous note. On the replacement of the ה suffix with א see vol. 1, Introduction 2.4.2.7, p. 26.

/יהושעיא So in the Vatican 487 Ms, see above, n. 10. On the replacement of the הsuffix with א see vol. 1, Introduction 2.4.2.7, p. 26. On the additional י see under Hezekiah (6) B/M in vol. 1, pp. 95, and 96, n. 17.
person.note: So in the London – BL Harl. 5508 (400), the Oxford Opp. Add. Fol. 23 and in the Munich 140 Mss. This person was obviously not well known, and his name was not stable so that scribes of the mss were not sure how to write it, see vol. 4, Introduction 5.2.1.1.2.1.1, pp. 23-4. For this form see above, n. 8.
So in the Goettingen 3, the Cambridge T-S F2 (2) 73 and the Munich 95 Mss, see previous note. On the replacement of the ה suffix with א see vol. 1, Introduction 2.4.2.7, p. 26.

So in the Vatican 487 Ms, see above, n. 10. On the replacement of the הsuffix with א see vol. 1, Introduction 2.4.2.7, p. 26. On the additional י see under Hezekiah (6) B/M in vol. 1, pp. 95, and 96, n. 17.
Although mentioned only here in BT, he reacts to the words of Palestinian sages (see Introduction 5.3.2.3) and in Hebrew, see Introduction 5.1.3.2.5.
Was a contemporary of the last tannaim, see Introduction 7.4.1.
